title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

09:01 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:09 <vmassol> I'm working on the distribution-tests module build right now (fyi)  
09:09 <vmassol> has quit  
09:12 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <phancox> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <phancox> has left #xwiki  
09:31 <+cjdelisle> hmm javax.tools.JavaCompiler is available by default. Why don't we have a {{java}} macro?  
09:31 <vmassol> what's the point?  
09:31 <vmassol> we have {{groovy}}  
09:31 <vmassol> which is 100% compat  
09:31 <vmassol> you can write pure java with it  
09:32 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <+cjdelisle> http://shootout.alioth.debian.org/gp4/benchmark.php?test=recursive&lang=all  
09:33 <+cjdelisle> that's what prompted me to think of it. java 6 seconds, groovy 9 minutes.  
09:33 <vmassol> honestly I believe this is not the direction  
09:33 <+cjdelisle> actually groovy is 99.9% compat. there are a few weird things such as array literals.  
09:34 <vmassol> since java has introduced code for improving perf of dynamic scripting languages in the jvm  
09:34 <vmassol> IMO let's wait for someone with a need first  
09:35 <+cjdelisle> One consideration is if I wanted to setup a wiki instance I would want to drop as much of the bloat as possible to keep resources down. This means python and groovy if I could.  
09:36 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: if there is a ScriptEngine for it you can use {{script language="java"}}  
09:36 <vmassol> tmortagne: good point  
09:36 <+tmortagne> in java 6  
09:36 <+tmortagne> no whay that works on java 5  
09:37 <+cjdelisle> "Can't find script engine with name [java]"  
09:38 <vmassol> you need to drop an impl in WEB-INF/lib  
09:38 <+cjdelisle> I hadn't given it much thought but it just seemed to me it was a free feature IE: we have already paid in memory for the compiler since it's shipped in the vm.  
09:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: btw there's rhino by default in jdk6 (for the sun jvm)  
09:40 <vmassol> we've never advertised this but it shoudl work OOB  
09:40 <+tmortagne> yep i know  
09:40 <+tmortagne> jvelociter tested it  
09:40 <vmassol> does it work?  
09:40 <+tmortagne> but did not worked well  
09:40 <+tmortagne> he posted a jira about it  
09:40 <+tmortagne> let ma find it  
09:40 <+cjdelisle> I do remember once I compiled groovy and decompiled it with a java decompiler. The code was a huge mess.  
09:40 <vmassol> XWIKI-5586  
09:42 <+tmortagne> yep that one  
09:42 <+tmortagne> but appart from theses methods it's working AFAIK  
09:42 <+tmortagne> but without theses methods...  
09:46 <+cjdelisle> When you get a chance, I could use some advice on where to look for running tests multiple times with different configurations.  
09:48 <\_Sergey\_> has quit  
09:48 <vmassol> cjdelisle: sorry btu need to finish fixing the build I've broken  
09:48 <vmassol> asap  
09:48 <vmassol> since it's preventing a release right now  
09:48 <+cjdelisle> yup, no rush  
09:50 <vmassol> hmmm  
09:51 <vmassol> oops  
09:52 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <+sburjan> guys, something is wrong with the last build. I get some errors when starting xwiki  
10:31 <+sburjan> Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/sorinello/.xwiki/extensions/repository/org.jruby.extras%3Ajaffl-0.5.1.jar (No such file or directory)  
10:31 <+sburjan> and other files  
10:33 <+tmortagne> sburjan: try removing your ~/.xwiki/ folder  
10:34 <+sburjan> works now, yes  
10:34 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <+tmortagne> sburjan: probably caused by the half working extension install in an older build which produced you extension descriptor whithout their corresponding extensions  
10:36 <+tmortagne> it's was only log right ?  
10:36 <+sburjan> yes  
10:37 <+tmortagne> things like that should probably be warning intead  
10:37 <+tmortagne> \*instead  
10:37 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm not sure  
10:37 <+sburjan> after deleting the folder, it worked  
10:37 <vmassol> an extension could be required  
10:37 <vmassol> for the wiki to work  
10:37 <+tmortagne> what is the relationship with log ?  
10:38 <vmassol> ok yes warning is fine if we consider XE can run with any extension  
10:38 <vmassol> s/with/without/  
10:38 <vmassol> I agree  
10:40 <+sburjan> tmortagne: No more FileNotFound exceptions, but now I got a Velocicy stack trace when accessing Main.WebHome  
10:40 <+sburjan> Caused by: org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.TemplateParseException: Encountered ";}\n;-webkit-" at xwiki:resources.uicomponents[line 1, column 64]  
10:40 <+sburjan> Was expecting one of:  
10:40 <+sburjan>     "[" ...  
10:40 <+sburjan>     "}" ...  
10:40 <+tmortagne> does not seems related to extension manager, looks like there is a syntax error in main page  
10:41 <+sburjan> I know  
10:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you check my last commit re cluster-tests to verify it's ok (since I don't know those tests too well)?  
10:42 <+tmortagne> sburjan: looks like it's already a warning and not an error, can you confirm ?  
10:42 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok  
10:42 <+sburjan> tmortagne: I get a fullstack trace. so I guess it's an error  
10:42 <+lucaa> sburjan what are you testing on?  
10:42 <+sburjan> latest snapshot  
10:42 <+sburjan> XWiki Enterprise 3.0-SNAPSHOT.35747  
10:42 <+tmortagne> sburjan: youcould give me the whole thing ?  
10:43 <+sburjan> tmortagne: : yes  
10:43 <+lucaa> ok, lemme take it and look at it  
10:46 <+sburjan> tmortagne: http://pastebin.com/k7PcdAsC  
10:46 <+tmortagne> sburjan: not this one :)  
10:46 <+sburjan> thee xtension manager one ?  
10:46 <+tmortagne> yep  
10:46 <+sburjan> I deleted those file, I don't know if I'm able to reproduce :))  
10:47 <+tmortagne> it's okk if you don't have it aymore  
10:47 <+tmortagne> ok  
10:47 <+sburjan> are these errors saved in some log ?  
10:47 <+tmortagne> was to make sure but i think I know what's wrong  
10:47 <+tmortagne> I think  
10:47 <+tmortagne> but don't know well jetty log, do youhave a xwiki.log file ?  
10:48 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: do you remember where jetty log are written in the jetty+hsqldb distrib ?  
10:49 <+sburjan> tmortagne: nope  
10:49 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <+sburjan> I have xwiki.log for 2.6 and 2.7  
10:49 <lucaa> has quit  
10:51 <+sburjan> odd, don't have it for any 3.0 snapshot  
10:52 <+tmortagne> maybe we changed that for a jetty specific file, try finding a log folder or something like that  
10:53 <vmassol> guys: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XTJETTY-21  
10:53 <@sdumitriu> There's no file for Jetty  
10:54 <vmassol> I think sergiu removed the log file  
10:55 <+sburjan> ok. so I don't have it :)  
11:02 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:02 <vmassol> btw no myxwiki.org restart for the past 3-4 days :)  
11:03 <vmassol> past 5 days actually  
11:03 <+cjdelisle> Do we get postmordom logs whenever it restarts?  
11:03 <vmassol> yes  
11:03 <vmassol> actually that reminds me  
11:04 <vmassol> http://markmail.org/thread/5rlnqbm2ulnveipv  
11:04 <vmassol> I need to get that going  
11:04 <+cjdelisle> Where are the logs? Are they somewhere I can dig through them?  
11:05 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <vmassol> cjdelisle: they're sent to some individuals right now  
11:05 <vmassol> (hence the need for that infra list)  
11:05 <vmassol> I can fwd it to you  
11:05 <vmassol> (for now)  
11:06 <vmassol> done  
11:06 <+tmortagne> vmassol: re cluster: a connection refused probably means there is an issue with the XWiki executor  
11:06 <+cjdelisle> thanks.  
11:07 <+cjdelisle> btw:  
11:07 <+cjdelisle> orage/profiles/Profile.java:[22,21] cannot find symbol  
11:07 <+cjdelisle> [ERROR] symbol  : class XWikiExecutor  
11:07 <+cjdelisle> [ERROR] location: package org.xwiki.test  
11:07 <+cjdelisle> I even explicitly pulled in commons-test.  
11:08 <vmassol> cjdelisle: in which module?  
11:08 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: What's with XWIKI-4953 ? Can it be closed?  
11:08 <+lucaa> mflorea: what's the status of the release? can I still commit now?  
11:09 <+lucaa> (and all guys in general)  
11:09 <+cjdelisle> vmassol: I'm having the problem in storage-tests  
11:09 <+cjdelisle> sdumitriu: Yes it has apparently been fixed in surtefire, I will close it.  
11:09 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok fixing it  
11:09 <vmassol> didn't know we were using executors in unit tests  
11:09 <vmassol> that's strange  
11:09 <+mflorea> lucaa: go ahead, I'm still reading my mails..  
11:09 <+lucaa> :) ok  
11:09 <+lucaa> we will have a RC2, right?  
11:09 <vmassol> no  
11:09 <+lucaa> just in case I do a big mess now  
11:10 <+lucaa> vmassol:  no?  
11:10 <vmassol> correct  
11:10 <+mflorea> final is planned in one week  
11:10 <vmassol> and RC is RC  
11:10 <vmassol> anodther RC is done only if a critical bug remains  
11:10 <vmassol> RC means candidate  
11:10 <+lucaa> vmassol:  what does that mean?  
11:10 <+lucaa> ok  
11:10 <+lucaa> ok, I'll commit, we'll see :)  
11:10 <vmassol> we don't plan bugs ;)  
11:10 <vmassol> especially critical ones  
11:11 <+lucaa> hehe :)  
11:11 <+lucaa> yes, but let's say that if I test more this thing, it might miss the RC therefore the release  
11:12 <+cjdelisle> re XWIKI-4953, we still have forkmode pertest. I can remove that but anyone using the old version of surefire will still get OOM issues.  
11:12 <+cjdelisle> Also I can change it to forkmode always which will only fork per test class instead of per test method which should be much faster.  
11:13 <+cjdelisle> WDYT?  
11:14 <+cjdelisle> BTW: I think it is this: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/SUREFIRE-495  
11:15 <+tmortagne> vmassol: XWikiExecutor should not be in xwiki-commons since it's really not commons stuff  
11:15 <vmassol> yep I agree  
11:15 <vmassol> for 3.1 I think  
11:15 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:15 <vmassol> or not...  
11:16 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: We can try to remove the fork  
11:17 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I can build xwiki-store fine  
11:18 <+cjdelisle> storage-tests is the one that needs XWikiExecutor  
11:18 <vmassol> ah and it's not executed  
11:18 <+cjdelisle> enterprise/distribution-tests/storage-tests  
11:19 <vmassol> oh sorry  
11:19 <vmassol> didn't svn up  
11:19 <vmassol> (and was in platform/core)  
11:19 <vmassol> fixing  
11:19 <+cjdelisle> I'm looking now to see if the surefire patch was ported to a version compatable with maven2.x  
11:20 <+cjdelisle> heh easier to just run it  
11:22 <vmassol> cjdelisle: when you can would be good to use the new XWikiExecutorSuite instead  
11:22 <+cjdelisle> Where do I find it?  
11:23 <vmassol> done  
11:23 <vmassol> you can check rest-tests's AllTests  
11:23 <vmassol> it's in common-test  
11:23 <vmassol> xwiki-commons-test  
11:25 <+cjdelisle> oh is it new? I need to pull the new changes.  
11:25 <vmassol> it's new from an hour again ;)  
11:27 <+tmortagne> vmassol: created XCOMMONS-3  
11:28 <+lucaa> guys, I just committed XWIKI-6092 . It would be lovely if you had time to give it a few clicks until the rel ( sburjan, if you're not busy with something more important )  
11:28 <+lucaa> (I'm gonna test it now in IE)  
11:29 <+sburjan> lucaa: I'm a little busy atm, but I will take a look too before rel  
11:29 <+lucaa> sburjan: sure  
11:30 <+cjdelisle> thanks sdumitriu for cleaning up my open files mistake. That should not be an issue with the new storage since the lock is associated with the stream so I was eager to close asap.  
11:31 <Denis> has quit  
11:31 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Yes, I've seen that the new FSAC already uses an AutoCloseIS  
11:32 <@sdumitriu> Was it used already in my initial patch?  
11:32 <+cjdelisle> I don't remember. I actually didn't use very much of it.  
11:32 <+cjdelisle> 3 programmers == 3 solutions to a given problem ;)  
11:33 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
11:33 <+cjdelisle> todo is remove the attachment content entirely so that the upload pipes directly to it's final location then just does a rename for safety.  
11:34 <@sdumitriu> @all, I'd like some feedback on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/UserMessagesVisibility ASAP, I'm already implementing it, so scream fast if there's something you don't like  
11:34 <+cjdelisle> and cut out fileupload plugin  
11:34 <@sdumitriu> Yes, it's wrong to use "fileupload" for normal attachment storage  
11:35 <+cjdelisle> that and plugins--;  
11:36 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <Denis2> has quit  
11:36 <vmassol> sdumitriu: but today is the RC....  
11:36 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Yes, so?  
11:36 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <vmassol> well according to your last message you still plan to commit important stuff  
11:37 <vmassol> which means it won't be tested  
11:37 <+cjdelisle> :) I'd hate to think I was the only one.  
11:37 <vmassol> s/tested/tested thoroughly/  
11:37 <vmassol> (I'm reading http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/UserMessagesVisibility)  
11:37 <+cjdelisle> bbiab coffee  
11:38 <@sdumitriu> 1. I doubt that the release will happen today  
11:38 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <Denis> has quit  
11:38 <@sdumitriu> 2. There's time to fix before the final  
11:38 <@sdumitriu> 3. I doubt that I'll introduce many bugs  
11:38 <vmassol> I hate that 1 seems to be the norm and that devs are counting on it now :(  
11:39 <@sdumitriu> Me too  
11:39 <vmassol> note : I have my share of guilt too since I broke the build saturday, was a bad move  
11:40 <vmassol> (didn't realize i was going to rbeak it and instead of reverting, I've tried to fix it)  
11:40 <vmassol> seems there are lots of tests failing now  
11:42 <vmassol> sdumitriu: "all his messages";…. hmm isn't that confusing?  
11:42 <vmassol> (for reg users)  
11:42 <@sdumitriu> Why?  
11:42 <vmassol> for me the homr dashboard was the same for everyone  
11:43 <vmassol> so indeed we need to decide about this  
11:43 <+tmortagne> vmassol: i get http://pastebin.com/LC0yD58E when trying to build cluster-tests  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> WDYM by "same for everyone"?  
11:44 <vmassol> whether it's a personal dashboard or a wiki one for everyone  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> Everyone sees what guests see?  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> I don't agree  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> How do I see the messages from my followed user? Do I have to go to the network tab?  
11:44 <Denis2> has left #xwiki  
11:44 <vmassol> I'm brainstorming, we didn't really had this use case befofore  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> And that rule is already broken  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> Admins see wiki events from blacklisted spaces  
11:45 <vmassol> yes it's broken with perms already  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> Normal users don't  
11:45 <@sdumitriu> And the "accessible" part also means that different users will see different things  
11:46 <vmassol> ok I agree  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> I see the dashboard as something personal  
11:46 <+tmortagne> vmassol: also there is no XE distributions in target folder  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> I see what I'm interested in (the users I follow)  
11:46 <vmassol> tmortagne: strange I don't get this  
11:47 <vmassol> maybe you're missing some other modules not built  
11:47 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Let's ask Fabio  
11:47 <vmassol> sdumitriu: yes ok although I agree now about personal dashboard  
11:49 <vmassol> lucaa: anno bug!  
11:49 <vmassol> on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/UserMessagesVisibility#Annotations  
11:49 <vmassol> I added an anno on the first question mark icon (text left ot it)  
11:49 <vmassol> but it's been wrongly added to the same text but elsewehre above  
11:50 <vmassol> basically it's been added to the first instance of "all his messages"  
11:50 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I know what's wrong, that's because of m2eclipse that makes me change the pom packaging  
11:57 <vmassol> already 14 tests failing in ui-tests: http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/478/testReport/  
11:57 <+lucaa> vmassol: ok, noted. thanks for the ping  
11:58 <vmassol> @lucaa: want a jira? is it hard to fix (might be no?),  
11:58 <+lucaa> vmassol:  add it to the bug reported by Tim something (forgot his name)  
11:58 <vmassol> ah we still need to fix teh build on mac too… that's a pain....  
11:59 <+lucaa> put the example in the name  
11:59 <+lucaa> in the comment  
11:59 <+lucaa> XE-861 iirc  
11:59 <vmassol> wow already 32 open bugs on annot  
12:00 <vmassol> ok  
12:00 <+lucaa> 32 bugs open on annos?  
12:00 <vmassol> (ah no not just bugs, issues in general)  
12:00 <+lucaa> you could also move that from XE to XAANNOTATIONS  
12:03 <vmassol> reminder: we need to fix the build on mac….  
12:04 <vmassol> so what's the pb yui-compressor?  
12:05 <+tmortagne> vmassol: as far as i can see the issue is that for some reason only one executor is started  
12:05 <vmassol> ah… maybe I made a mistake in XWikiExecutorSuite  
12:05 <+tmortagne> so there is a bug in the XWikiExecutorSuite  
12:05 <+tmortagne> or the @XWikiExecutorSuite.Executors(2) is not taken into account  
12:05 <vmassol> checking  
12:07 <sdumitriu> has quit  
12:08 <vmassol> I don't see anything wrong visually, need to debug (but lunch first)  
12:09 <+lucaa> sburjan I think I found the exception cause  
12:09 <+sburjan> @devs: I think I found out a bug in Blog. When I create a new article,  the Page Name and Page Title Gets the name I enter in the box. When editing article, I change the name Page title. This does not change the page Name. This is normal. But when changing Page title from inline edit, it is \*not\* updated when viewing the article.  
12:10 <+sburjan> To change the name that appears when Viewing the Article, I must edit in wiki or WYSIWYG. Is this normal ? IMO it is not nice  
12:11 <+sburjan> short version: inline edit mode of blog does not update properly the title. Or title put in the inline editor, is \*not\* used when viewing the article (full article page)  
12:14 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <harshanianu\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <harshanianu\_> has quit  
12:30 <PaRiDa> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <evalica> has quit  
12:32 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:32 <PaRiDa> i would like to work on the mobile skin for xwiki ... for gsoc.. is anyone onto it or willing to discuss that ?  
12:49 <+evalica> PaRiDa: do you have any questions about the project? you can also send a mail to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) presenting some ideas or requesting for answers or feedback  
12:50 <PaRiDa> i was thinking to incorporate tablet skins aswell to the scheme of things.
